dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3892797A] re: Microsoft Corporation - examshots.com
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: Brian C. Roche [mailto:broche@rochepia.com] Sent: Monday, April 30, 2007 10:56 AM To: DMCA Cc: Copyright; Abuse Subject: RE: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3892797A] re: Microsoft Corporation - examshots.com Pursuant to your request. Attachment included again. Letter cut and pasted below: April 27, 2007 VIA EMAIL AND FEDERAL EXPRESS The Planet 835 Greens Parkway, Suite 150 Houston, Texas 77067 Attention: Abuse Department copyright@theplanet.com abuse@theplanet.com Re: CEASE AND DESIST - www.examshots.com Dear Sir or Madam: I declare, under penalties of perjury, that this firm represents and is authorized to act on behalf of Microsoft Corporation ("Microsoft"). Microsoft has information that a website identified as www.examshots.com (the "Website") is offering so called "test taking services" through which the operators/agents of the Website offer to take Microsoft's certification examinations on behalf of candidates by falsifying the candidate registrations and/or other related documents. The Website is currently being hosted by ev1servers.net, which is now merged with the Planet (the "Planet"). Copies of relevant pages from the Website are attached hereto as Exhibit A. Microsoft is the creator, author, and owner of numerous certification exams, including (1) MCSA on Windows Server 2003; (2) MCSE on Windows Server 2003; (3) MCSE: Security on Windows Server 2003; (4) MCDBA; and (5) MCAD (collectively referred to as the "Certification Exams"), among others, all of which are protected by United States and international law. By offering to take, and in fact taking, Microsoft's Certification Exams on behalf of third-parties, under false pretenses, the Website is engaging in, among other things, fraudulent conduct, actionable under various civil laws. The Website's conduct also involves the improper and unauthorized use of Microsoft's trademarks, and likely involves direct, contributory, or vicarious copyright infringement of Microsoft's copyrighted Certification Exams. Additionally, the Website is breaching and/or inducing others to breach certain Confidentiality Agreements with Microsoft, and its conduct involves the misappropriation and/or other improper use of Microsoft's trade secrets. The foregoing conduct is actionable under United States, international, and/or local law. The Planet appears to have assisted this unlawful conduct by providing hosting and other services. In light of the information set forth above and the notice provided by same, Microsoft requests and demands that the Planet confirm that it has terminated or will terminate its support of this unlawful conduct. Should such conduct continue in the future, the Planet may incur contributory and/or vicarious liability for copyright and/or trademark infringement and any other unlawful activities. You should also know that the Website recently had its account suspended by Ecommerce Corporation for this conduct. As a result of that suspension, the Website is now utilizing the Planet to perform identical services on its behalf. In order to protect its Certification Examinations, Microsoft hereby demands that the Planet: (1) cease and desist from any storing, publishing, posting, distributing, offering for sale or selling of the "test taking services" on the Website; (2) immediately disable access to the Website; and (3) terminate the support of the aforementioned unlawful activity. Please be advised that Microsoft reserves all of its rights to seek all appropriate legal and equitable relief arising out of the aforementioned violations of law. I look forward to your anticipated cooperation with this request. Very truly yours, Brian C. Roche, Esq. BCR/sib Enclosures -----Original Message----- From: DMCA [mailto:dmca@theplanet.com] Sent: Monday, April 30, 2007 11:21 AM To: broche@rochepia.com Cc: Copyright Subject: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3892797A] re: Microsoft Corporation - examshots.com Please re-send the below-pasted e-mail since there is no attachment. Sorry for the inconvenience. Legal Response Team -----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Sent: Saturday, April 28, 2007 9:52 PM To: DMCA Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3892797A] re: Microsoft Corporation - examshots.com ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. re: Microsoft Corporation - examshots.com Added by system at Friday, Apr 27 2007 12:21 pm X-MailFrom: broche@rochepia.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Fri Apr 27 12:21:24 2007 Received: (qmail 23212 invoked by alias); 27 Apr 2007 17:21:24 -0000 Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net Received: (qmail 23209 invoked from network); 27 Apr 2007 17:20:51 -0000 Received: from smtp01.theplanet.com (70.87.6.110) by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 27 Apr 2007 17:20:51 -0000 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp01.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Fri, 27 Apr 2007 12:20:50 -0500 Return-path: Delivery-date: Fri, 27 Apr 2007 12:20:50 -0500 Received: from mx01.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.180] helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from broche@rochepia.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1HhU7k-0005qt-8D; Fri, 27 Apr 2007 12:20:50 -0500 Received: from cl35.gs01.gridserver.com ([64.13.192.44]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from broche@rochepia.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1HhU7X-000Ltb-Ro; Fri, 27 Apr 2007 12:20:36 -0500 Received: from c-76-23-170-152.hsd1.ct.comcast.net ([76.23.170.152]:4522 helo=rochepia1) by cl35.gs01.gridserver.com with esmtpa (Exim 4.50) id 1HhU6d-00026l-Sr; Fri, 27 Apr 2007 10:20:23 -0700 From: "Brian C. Roche" To: , Cc: "'Gerald Pia'" Subject: re: Microsoft Corporation - examshots.com Date: Fri, 27 Apr 2007 13:19:27 -0400 Message-ID: <003501c788f0$37865eb0$6a00a8c0@rochepia1> MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0036_01C788CE.B074BEB0" X-Mailer: Microsoft Office Outlook 11 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.3028 thread-index: AceI8DVPJhwYdQVNTMOWbGrKWiusVQ== X-OriginalArrivalTime: 27 Apr 2007 17:20:50.0275 (UTC) FILETIME=[66DEBB30:01C788F0] (multipart/mixed) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. (multipart/alternative) MIME element (text/plain) Dear Sir or Madam: This firm represents Microsoft Corporation. Please see the attached Letter and Exhibit related to examshots.com which is currently being hosted by your company. Microsoft looks forward to your prompt attention to this important matter. Sincerely, Brian C. Roche, Esq. Roche Pia LLC Two Corporate Drive, Suite 234 Shelton, CT 06484 Tel: 203.944.0235 Fax: 203.225.1244 www.rochepia.com This transmittal may be a confidential attorney-client communication or may otherwise be privileged or confidential. If it is not clear that you are the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that you have received this transmittal in error; any review, dissemination, distribution or copying of this transmittal is strictly prohibited. If you suspect that you have received this communication in error, please notify us immediately by telephone at 203.944.0235, or e-mail at info@rochepia.com and immediately delete this message and all its attachments.
